public displays of affection that is

would you give up this is a second
conditional sentence which we use to
talk about hypothetical or imaginary
situations the second conditional
follows the structure if you plus a verb
in the past
you would plus a verb in the infinitive
as in if we fought I would win
now what Phoebe says is an interrogated
second conditional sentence if you had
two what would you give up food or sex
another example with a similar structure
would be if you want a million dollars
what would you buy also did you notice
the pronunciation of would plus you in
American English this combination of D
plus y often morphs to a gym sound even
between words so depending on the
following vowel this can result in a
jump or jus sound although you do not
have to say it this way it is useful to
know to understand when a native is
using the conditional because often you
will hear would you or would you instead
